Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 14:11 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers have now connected a temporary generator on the underground network in the RH19 4 and RH18 5 area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 4 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent at 13:38 by Talie - Further generators have now been connected and there are now seven properties still without electricity. If this is the case at your property, don't worry; I'll still keep you informed.

If your electricity has come back on now, or does so at any time in the future, simply click this link to stop receiving our SMS updates: bit.ly/348KOZ3.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 11:53 - Hello again. Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut, I know the lights being off is a worry.

Our staff have advised that they are awaiting the arrival of the remaining temporary generators to be connected. Due to the delay this has caused, they've advised a new time of 14:30-15:30 to have your power back on.

I know another delay is frustrating; our engineers always try to give us the best estimate that they can but due to the safety elements of working with live electricity, sometimes they have to adjust their repairs at short notice.

I'm sorry if this has caused you to change any plans you've made, but we'll be here to update you until the lights are safely back on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 19:28. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 19:52 - We can now confirm that all power in the Ashfield Avenue, WD23 4 area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground fault, which our engineers have made repairs to.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 18:27 - Thanks for your patience over today.

Our engineers have let us know th repairs are taking longer than expected. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 19:00 and 20:00.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut today, our staff will work to restore your power as quickly and as safely as possible. A lot of our customers have questions regarding power cuts, and though you can always reach our team, you can also find some helpful information and answers to some of our most frequently asked questions on our website here - https://bit.ly/3pTfAz9 - Bear in mind this will use your mobile data, so feel free to speak to us if you'd prefer. We'll be in touch again once we have more information from our staff.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified cables and 6 poles that need replacing and upgrading. We will also be replacing stay wires and transferring service cables to the new poles. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place in Cooks Drove. A road closure will be in place to allow the work to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 11:27 - We can now confirm that all power in the Glebelands Avenue area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Theo at 10:26
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Glebelands Avenue area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault occurred on a piece of our electrical equipment which controls the power to your home.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Theo at 11:27 - We can now confirm that all power in the Glebelands Avenue area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Theo at 10:26

Our staff have now arrived on site in the Glebelands Avenue area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Theo at 10:14.

equipment in your area. This has identified 4 cables and 3 poles that need upgrading. Doing this

works prior to the power cut.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
This work is taking place near Rocklands
Road. 
To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees
near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close to 2 spans of cables,
which could damage the cables and affect your electricity supply.
Our contractors need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away
from the cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future
as we appreciate that some customers may have experienced multiple unplanned power cuts in
the last 6 months.

Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Church Road.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 22:42 - We can now confirm that all power in the ME9 7 area should be back on. Our engineers have diverted power around an underground network fault. However, due to the location and complexity of the issue, we have also used temporary generators to restore power to the last of the affected properties. This will provide power until our engineers plan in and safely complete the full repair, which may take a few days.

We're really sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Will - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

I know that power being off may be especially worrying for you as we head later into the evening, but our field teams work 24 hours so I'll let know further news as soon as it comes in.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 21:59 - Just a quick update to let you know our temporary generators  have arrived and engineers are in the process of connecting them/. The power may come back on to your area in stages.

There was a delay in the final generator arriving so we have had to make a slight amendment to the estimated time frame and we're now aiming to have all supplies back on between 23:00 and 00:00.

We're sorry to have had to make this change and we'll keep you updated with progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Roland at 21:24 - As it's approaching that time of night where most of our customers are going to sleep, we wanted to let you know that we will continue to send text messages throughout the night with progress updates. If you want to continue receiving updates but prefer not to be disturbed, you can place your phone on silent or activate the Do Not Disturb settings on smart phones. If you no longer want to receive updates, you will need to visit our website here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Thank you

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified 6 poles that need replacing and upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the poles. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our engineers will be erecting the new poles on the 3rd of December 2025. This work is taking place on Church Lane. Traffic signage will be in place on the 3rd and 4th of December 2025 to allow the work to be carried out safely.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 15:23 - Thanks for your patience today. Our engineers have now investigated the grounded cables, and have deemed it safe to restore power back to all 599 properties in the Dover CT15 area.

We're very sorry we had to turn your power off unexpectedly, and with so little warning. We usually provide much more notice if we can, but in a situation like this our first priority is the safety of the public and our staff.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. If your power is still off or if you have any questions, call our team on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 15:04 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity. Our engineers have turned off the power in the Dover CT15 area in the interest of the public's health and safety. This is so they can investigate reports of an overhead cable that is on the ground.

If in the area, please take care and stay at least 10m away from the cable. 

Until our engineers arrive on site and investigate, it's difficult to advise you a time frame. However, based on an average for this kind of issue, our estimated time to have you back on is between 18:00 and 19:00

We'll keep you updated with our progress, but in the meantime our team are always here to talk on 105 if you have any questions or concerns.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 19:19 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the Herbert Road area should now be back on.

I'm sorry for the continued disruption recently. We believe there may be a fault on our underground electricity cabling in the area, but currently it has not developed to a stage that our staff can pinpoint it. Their tests have proven inconclusive, so for now they have replaced our safety equipment at the substation to get your power back on as quickly as possible.

This may happen again before we're able to fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Herbert Road area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Luke at 18:52.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 18:29 - Our staff are on the way to the Herbert Road area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 21:30 and 22:30. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Good afternoon, this is a message from Donna at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut which is currently in progress today the 4th December 2025 in the CB25 postcode area.
The power was switched off at 09:00 to enable our engineers to replace and upgrade some overhead electricity cables with improved insulated cables in School Lane.
Our engineers have advised us that works have gone better than anticipated and the affected properties will be restored early at approximately 12:15. 
Now that these works have been completed this will improve the reliability of our electricity network and will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut.
Our reference number for this work is INCD-105256-C.
I hope that the power coming on earlier is of benefit to you. We always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered you a 10/10 service then please call us on 105. Thank you.

This work is taking place near Station Road.

We are removing overhead electricity cables and replacing them with new underground electricity
cables. We will also be upgrading a piece of equipment known as a transformer. Doing this will
reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has
been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months.
To carry out the work safely we need to turn your power off. To ensure the power is off for the
shortest possible time, our contractors may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 18:13 - Our engineers have now restored power to all 350 customers in the Edenbridge TN8 area, by removing debris from our overhead cables and repairing the damage. We know a power cut can be difficult; we're sorry for any disruption this unplanned power cut caused.  

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations.

To talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 17:22 - Thanks for your patience this evening.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Edenbridge TN8 area and are investigating the fault. You may find your power is going on and off; that is normal for this type of issue and is due to our engineers working to divert power remotely. By doing this, we've managed to restore power to 143 customers. There are now 207 properties still affected. We'll keep sending SMS updates until everybody is restored. IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate you may have been impacted by unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place on land near Mill Lane.

Steps.Message: Good morning, this is a message from Harry at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut that is scheduled for today the 4th December 2025 in the LU6 postcode area. Our engineers have advised us that unfortunately there is going to be a delay in the power being switched off. This is due to access issues on site as a result of the wet ground conditions. We now estimate to switch off your power between approximately 09:45 and 10:15. Our reference number for this work is INCD-15810-I. We would like to apologise for any inconvenience this may cause you. If you have any questions or you have moved from the LU6 postcode area, then please give us a call on 105.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified 4 electricity cables, 1 service cables and 4 electricity poles that need replacing and upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to replace and upgrade the equipment. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. Our contractors will need access to the inside of your property to conduct safety checks in the morning before we switch off the power and we will need to do another check when we turn the power back on. This work is taking place on Frettenham Road.

Steps.Message: Hi, I'm Ebony and I'm the manager of the text messaging team at UK Power Networks. Today's power cut was an unexpected overhead network fault that affected 1551 properties, so I'm sorry that we weren't able to provide you with prior notice. I'm pleased to report our staff have resolved this by diverting power to get your lights back on as soon as possible. We contact customers when we are made aware of problems like this, so if you would like to be notified in future let us know here https://bit.ly/3zyHC6L I personally apologise for the disruption this caused you. We aim to provide a 10/10 service in keeping you updated, so if you'd like to talk to us about anything or are still without power, please call us on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 21:18 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 1551 customers in the Grays, Stanford-Le-Hope and Upminster areas, by diverting the power around an overhead network fault. We know your power may have been off for a long time, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 16:43. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: Our engineers had to redirect power due to a fault on the electricity network.

Logs.Comment:
Hi, I'm Ebony and I'm the manager of the text messaging team at UK Power Networks. Today's power cut was an unexpected overhead network fault that affected 1551 properties, so I'm sorry that we weren't able to provide you with prior notice. I'm pleased to report our staff have resolved this by diverting power to get your lights back on as soon as possible.

We contact customers when we are made aware of problems like this, so if you would like to be notified in future let us know here https://bit.ly/3zyHC6L

I personally apologise for the disruption this caused you. We aim to provide a 10/10 service in keeping you updated, so if you'd like to talk to us about anything or are still without power, please call us on 105.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close, which could damage the cables and affect your electricity supply. Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away from the cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place on Upper Bush Road.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 20:12 - Thanks for your patience today. Our engineers have now investigated the grounded overhead cables, and have deemed it safe to restore power back to all 110 properties in the Haywards Heath RH17 area.

We're very sorry we had to turn your power off unexpectedly, and with so little warning. We usually provide much more notice if we can, but in a situation like this our first priority is the safety of the public and our staff.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. If your power is still off or if you have any questions, call our team on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

We have been alerted to a potentially dangerous situation involving a grounded overhead cable following a road traffic collision, so have responded as quickly as possible and asked our control room to turn power off to the area using our high voltage network. This is why a wide area has lost electricity.

Once further specialist field staff have assessed the situation, we'll start diverting power back to affected homes as soon as they advise us it's safe. You may notice your lights going on and off as we work to get as much power restored as we can.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 18:35 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity. Our engineers have turned off the power in the Haywards Heath RH17 area in the interest of the public's health and safety. This is so they can investigate reports of a an overhead cable that is on the ground.

If in the area, please take care and stay at least 10m away from the cable. 

Until our engineers arrive on site and investigate, it's difficult to advise you a time frame. However, based on an average for this kind of issue, our estimated time to have you back on is between 21:30 and 22:30. 

We'll keep you updated with our progress, but in the meantime our team are always here to talk on 105 if you have any questions or concerns.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 14:43 - Our engineers have now restored power to all 536 customers in the BN5/BN44/ RH13 area, by removing a large tree from our overhead cables & repaired the damaged power lines. We know power may have been off for a long time; we're sorry for any disruption this unplanned power cut caused. 

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations

To talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us that the tree has been removed from our cabling and they are now in the process of repairing the line.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 15:00 and 16:00 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Talie at 13:56.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers are continuing their work to remove the tree from our cabling.

With the cold weather, we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating. If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on asap. Sent by Talie at 13:10.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 11:07 - Our engineers have restored power to all 214 properties in the TN27 9 area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have diverted power around the overhead cable fault.

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations. 

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the TN27 9 area to investigate the power cut affecting 214 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Talie at 10:52.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 10:38 - Our engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is an overhead cable fault affecting 214 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 13:30 and 14:30. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future as we appreciate you may have been impacted by an unplanned fault in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Horseman Side.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lee at 11:08 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 564 customers that were affected in the CB25 9, CB5 9, CB25 0 area by diverting the power around a underground cable fault.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We are upgrading a piece of equipment called a transformer, following a customer request for a new electricity supply. We will also be replacing and upgrading an electricity pole. To ensure our engineers can carry out this work safely we will need to temporarily switch off your power. Once complete this work will adhere to the customer request, ensure our network can uphold the increased electricity usage in your area and it will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Honey Hill. Two way traffic lights will be in place to allow the works to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close, which could damage the cables and affect your electricity supply. To reduce future planned power cuts we will also be examining a piece of equipment on our electricity pole called a transformer which was originally scheduled for the 2nd December 2025. Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away from the cables and examine the transformer. Doing this will improve the reliability of the network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. This work is taking place in the Stanstead Hall area.
